model.search

Class SearchFlight

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.search.SearchFlight

  • public class SearchFlight
extends java.lang.Object
    This class search all the flights that satisfy customer's requirement of one-way trip. Class member attributes are the same as defined by the view. If customer requires return flight, departure and arrival input information should be exchanged inside this class.

        public SearchFlight()
        Default constructor Constructor without params. Requires object fields to be explicitly set using setter methods

      • SearchFlight

        public SearchFlight(java.lang.String departure,
                    java.lang.String arrival,
                    java.lang.String date,
                    java.lang.String seat,
                    boolean stop)
        Initializing constructor. All attributes are initialized with input values
        Parameters:
        departure - Three character code of the departure airport
        arrival - Three character code of the arrival airport
        date - Date of departure
        seat - Preference of seat class on the airplane
        stop - Number of stopOver from departure to arrival

      • addDay

        public java.lang.String addDay(java.lang.String date)
                        throws java.text.ParseException
        This method adds one day to date given as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        date - represents the date in "yyyy MMM dd HH:mm z" string format.
        Returns:
        date represents in "yyyy MMM dd HH:mm z" string format.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the date parsing fails

      • isValidStopOver

        public boolean isValidStopOver(java.lang.String arrivalTime,
                               java.lang.String departureTime)
                        throws java.text.ParseException
        This method checks for the constraints that the layOver time in the range of (0.5hr, 4hr).
        Parameters:
        arrivalTime - arrival time of last flight in "yyyy MMM dd HH:mm z" format.
        departureTime - departure time of next flight in "yyyy MMM dd HH:mm z" format.
        Returns:
        true if satisfies layOver time constraints.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - is thrown when the date parsing fails

      • checkNextDay

        public boolean checkNextDay(java.lang.String arrivalTime)
                     throws java.text.ParseException
        This method check the next day flights for any flight that arrives after 20:00.
        Parameters:
        arrivalTime - represents the arrival time of a flight in "yyyy MMM dd HH:mm z" string format.
        Returns:
        true if arrival time of a flight is after 9pm else returns false boolean value.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the date parsing fails

      • checkValidConnectedFlight

        public boolean checkValidConnectedFlight(model.flight.Flight lastFlight,
                                         model.flight.Flight nextFlight)
                                  throws java.text.ParseException
        This method check if the connected flight is valid. It will both check seats and lay over time.
        Parameters:
        lastFlight - represents the first flight arrives at the airport
        nextFlight - represents the second flight departs from the airport
        Returns:
        true if connected flight is valid, false if connected flight is invalid
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the date parsing fails

      • search

        public java.util.List<model.flight.Flights> search()
                                            throws java.text.ParseException
        This method search all the flights that satisfies user requirement
        Returns:
        list of Flights depart from mDepartureAirportCode and arrive at mArrivalAirportCode on mDepartureDate
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the date parsing fails
